title: On CBI takeovers: a judicial standpoint
content: The Supreme Court has transferred the investigation into the Karur stampede from an SIT to the CBI. However, the top court’s reasoning, entirely based on petitioners’ pleadings, unaccompanied by prima facie evidence, is simply not enough to shift a case to the CBI

title: Mangling Chennai’s street names and distorting history
content: Rajachar Street in T. Nagar is spelt in three different ways on the signboards of the Chennai Corporation. The street is named after S.N.V. Rajachar who served as the Chief Presidency Magistrate in Madras.

title: How Janaki Ramachandran became the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu after MGR’s demise
content: Her regime lasted only 24 days until the dismissal of the AIADMK government in January 1988, after which she quit politics a year later.

title: How a rattled Jayalalithaa tackled Vijayakant’s political reach
content: In 2011, Jayalalithaa tied up with Vijayakant’s DMDK to take on the ruling DMK.  However, in February 2012, the AIADMK leader snapped relations with the DMDK following a showdown with Vijayakant in the Assembly.

title: QB Wilson calls out ex-coach Payton as 'classless'

title: Tirupati district on high alert as heavy rains loom
content: Control rooms in Tirupati and Gudur activated; Collector directs officials to monitor low-lying areas, ensure relief readiness, and guide farmers to protect crops and livestock

title: Allahabad HC directs SP Bahraich to probe case of minors booked for rioting
content: Court asks Superintendent of Police to act against erring officials if false implication of children is confirmed

title: Gitanjali Angmo’s ‘surveillance’ raises question on personal freedoms of NSA detainee’s family members
content: Sonam Wangchuk’s wife told the Supreme Court that she was accompanied by security personnel, her meetings supervised, not allowed to meet anyone in Jodhpur and was ‘taken’ to the railway station, ‘constantly’ surveilled in Delhi, among other infringements of her ‘fundamental rights as a free citizen of India’

title: One toilet for 120 tribal girls living in Thirunelli Ashram School
content: Students have been facing a harrowing time ever since the girls’ hostel was declared unsafe in July this year, and they are now living in three classrooms

title: Government asks utilities to carry out maintenance after CEA detects failure in 75 EHV transmission towers
content: These assets are owned by 12 players, including Adani Transmission, ReNew Transmission Ventures, Resonia Limited (erstwhile Sterlite Power Transmission Ltd), Powergrid and NTPC, said the report

title: Tribal trio revives baby monkey, wins hearts in act of compassion in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Udaya, Sachithra and Saugandhika, members of the Ponmudi Vanasamrakshana Samiti, administered CPR on the monkey by performing chest compressions after it crashed on to tarred road, unconscious and suffering a wound to its forehead  due to electrocution

title: Seven new dialysis centres to come up in Andhra Pradesh
content: Being set up as part of the Pradhan Mantri National Dialysis Programme, these centres will obviate the need for people to travel long distances to reach a hospital for treatment, says Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Traffic diversions announced for Sadar Utsav at Narayanguda
content: The event will be held from 7 p.m. on Wednesday to 4 a.m. on Thursday at YMCA; visitors attending the Utsav can park their vehicles at Keshav Memorial College grounds

title: Chief Minister inaugurates new Palayam market in Kozhikode
content: A section of the vendors at the old market stage protest, expressing their unwillingness to move to the new facility

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's Pay Rises To $96.5 Million
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's total compensation for the financial year 20242025 has risen to $96.5 million -- his highest since taking charge of the company more than a decade ago.

title: Swami Prasad Maurya's 'Not Practical' Remark On Lakshmi Puja Sparks Row
content: Swami Prasad Maurya stated that if prayers alone could bring wealth, India would not have 80 crore people dependent on subsidised food grains.

title: Amid Drug Violence In Mexico, Security Firms On Alert For World Cup 2026
content: Gunshots rang out in a Mexico City warehouse as Leopoldo Cerdeira emptied a cartridge into a car door propped upon a stand.

title: Akhtar AKA Alexander: Man Posing As Scientist At Atomic Research Body Caught
content: A 60-year-old man has been arrested in Mumbai after police found that he was posing as a scientist at the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC), and maps, documents, fake degrees and passports were recovered from him.

title: With Sanae Takaichi Becoming Japan's 1st Female PM, What Changes For Women?
content: Sanae Takaichi took office on Tuesday as Japan's first female prime minister, but her surprisingly male-dominated cabinet and socially conservative track record have left some women ambivalent in a country that lags on gender equality.

title: From Pashmina Wool To Thangka Paintings, GST Rejig To Boost Ladakh's Economy
content: Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms will reduce costs and broaden markets for Ladakh's artisans, farmers, and tourism operators, and safeguard local crafts, the government said on Wednesday.

title: Threats, Violence, Pride: What It Means To Be A Trans Person In Pakistan
content: Despite winning the right to medically transition in 2018, many transgender people in Pakistan still turn to unqualified surgeons because of a lack of trained doctors, high costs, and cultural taboos.

title: 4 Of A Family Dead As Speeding Thar Hits 3 Bikes In Jaipur
content: A devastating road accident claimed four lives and left three others seriously injured when a speeding Thar vehicle collided with three motorcycles on NH-52 in the Chomu area of Jaipur, Rajasthan, on Wednesday.

title: Car Crashes Into White House Security Gate, Driver Arrested
content: A man was arrested in the United States after he drove his car into a security barrier outside the White House.

title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw Offers To Fund Bengaluru Road Repair, P Chidambaram Responds
content: Congress MP P Chidambaram has welcomed Biocon chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw's offer to fund the repair work of roads in Bengaluru.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Indians Are Growing Sick Of Customs Harassment - But Who Cares?
content: You would think that the Wintrack experience would serve as an example to other customs officials and make them more careful and professional when dealing with citizens. In fact, the opposite is true.

title: Video: Helipad Sinks As President Murmu's Chopper Lands In Kerala
content: The landing was originally planned at Nilackal near Pamba, but it was changed to Pramadam due to bad weather.

title: Ex-Thai PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra, Sacked Over Breach Of Ethics, Resigns
content: Thailand's recently removed prime minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra resigned Wednesday as leader of the party founded by her father, ex-premier Thaksin, signalling the potential end of the family's decades-long political dynasty.

title: Sunken Eyes, Frail Skin: 4-Month-Old Dies Of Malnutrition In Madhya Pradesh
content: Doctors said Hussain weighed barely two and a half kilograms, while a healthy child of his age should weigh at least five.

title: No Legal Barrier To Extradition To India: Big Belgium Setback For Mehul Choksi
content: The court, in its order, noted that the alleged crimes took place between December 31, 2016, and January 1, 2019, and that the statute of limitations had not expired in either India or Belgium.

title: Punjabi Singer Shot By Rohit Godara Gang In Canada, Then A Warning To Rivals
content: In a fresh bout of gang violence in Canada, miscreants associated with gangster Rohit Godara have taken credit for the attack on Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon.

title: Tamil Nadu Braces For Extremely Heavy Rain, Weather Office Issues Red Alert
content: Tamil Nadu is bracing for very heavy to extremely heavy rain, as a low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal is set to intensify into a depression today, triggering widespread downpours across coastal and northern districts.

title: TDP Leader Warns IPS Officer, Sparks 'Red Book Governance' Debate In Andhra
content: A video showing Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader JC Prabhakar Reddy openly criticising and warning a senior police officer has triggered widespread debate over political conduct and the state of law and order in Andhra Pradesh.

title: 'Political Islam Undermined Hindu Faith, Largely Overlooked In History': Yogi Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said that warriors like Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, Guru Gobind Singh, Maharana Pratap, and Maharana Sanga waged battles against "political Islam".

title: 'Anti-Corruption Body Ordering BMWs Tragic Irony': Congress MPs Slam Lokpal
content: Senior Congress leaders and Rajya Sabha MPs P Chidambaram and Abhishek Singhvi have slammed anti-corruption watchdog Lokpal after it moved to acquire seven BMW luxury cars for its members. Each of these cars costs about Rs 70 lakh on-road.

title: Delhi air pollution: Worst Diwali air in 4 years, Tuesday winds prevent ‘severe’ drop
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Diwali night as firecracker violations surged, pushing PM2.5 levels to their highest since 2021. Despite a temporary spike, rising winds and warmer temperatures prevented a prolonged severe episode. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with Stage III of GRAP not yet invoked.

title: Popular Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon shot at in Canada: Bullets pumped into stomach
content: Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon was shot in Canada by associates of gangster Rohit Godara, who claimed Kahlon supplied weapons and money to rival gangs and acted as an informant. This incident highlights an ongoing transnational gang feud, following the recent murder of businessman Ramesh Rulania in Rajasthan, also suspected to be linked to Godara's gang.

title: Chopper scare: President Murmu’s helicopter wheels sink into landing pad in Kerala
content: During her visit to Kerala, President Droupadi Murmu encountered a small mishap as her helicopter touched down on a helipad that unexpectedly sank. However, swift measures from the authorities ensured her well-being. Over the next four days, her agenda features a prominent pilgrimage to the revered Sabarimala temple, alongside several inaugural ceremonies and centenary festivities throughout the region.

title: 'Don't want to intervene...': India batting coach on RoKo; talks about their form
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak backed senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after their struggles in the first ODI against Australia. Kotak cited their IPL experience and strong preparation, dismissing concerns about rustiness. He also highlighted the impact of rain interruptions on the team's batting performance.

title: 'Pehle bhot bura haal tha': Nitish says he is back with NDA 'for good'
content: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar declared his return to the NDA "for good," citing "circumstances" as the reason for past alliances with the RJD. He criticized the RJD's previous rule, highlighting improvements in infrastructure, education, healthcare, and law and order under his leadership, while emphasizing his government's focus on women's empowerment.

title: ChatGPT gets browser: Google loses $150B; Chrome faces monopoly threat
content: OpenAI's new AI browser, ChatGPT Atlas, has shaken the tech world.  The launch caused a massive $150 billion drop in Alphabet's market value.  CEO Sam Altman called it a rare chance to redefine web browsing.  Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly, allowing AI to perform tasks.  This poses a significant challenge to Google's search advertising revenue.  Investors are watching closely as Google also integrates AI into its Chrome browser.  The competition for browser dominance is heating up.

title: Why no Sarfaraz in India A squad? 100-plus avg in first-class but ignored
content: Mumbai cricketers Sarfaraz Khan and Ayush Mhatre faced contrasting fortunes as India A squads were announced. Sarfaraz Khan was surprisingly ignored despite a strong domestic record, while 18-year-old Ayush Mhatre earned a fast-track call-up despite an ordinary recent tour.

title: Tamil Nadu rains: Chennai on orange alert, schools shut; cyclone expected
content: A low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal has intensified, bringing rain to coastal districts including Chennai. The India Meteorological Department has issued red and orange alerts for extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall in several north and delta districts on Wednesday and Thursday. The system may strengthen into a depression, with a possibility of developing into a cyclone.

title: Adelaide ODI shock: Virat Kohli safe, but Rohit Sharma in big trouble
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma aim for a strong comeback in the second ODI against Australia at Adelaide after a disappointing return in Perth. Kohli boasts an impressive record at Adelaide Oval, while Rohit seeks to improve his modest statistics. Experts believe the duo will find their rhythm and contribute significantly to India's batting success.

title: Satya Nadella's pay package rises to a record $96.5 million
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has secured a record-breaking $96.5 million compensation package for fiscal year 2025, a significant 22% increase. This substantial reward is attributed to his strategic leadership in artificial intelligence, a sector where Microsoft is making significant strides. The company's impressive financial performance, with revenue soaring to $281.7 billion, is directly linked to AI investments in products like Azure and Copilot.

title: Trump says he spoke to PM Modi about avoiding war with Pak; dials down Russian oil claims
content: US President Donald Trump announced that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured him India will significantly reduce its oil purchases from Russia. Trump mentioned this during a White House Diwali event. He also indicated that both leaders are working on trade deals. A potential meeting between Trump and Modi is being considered for the upcoming ASEAN summit.

title: Watch: Israeli settlers attack Palestinian farmers in West Bank
content: A Palestinian woman suffered a head injury after a masked Jewish settler attacked her during olive picking. The unprovoked assault in Turmus Ayya was captured on video. The incident is part of escalating settler violence against Palestinian farmers. The UN reports a significant rise in such attacks, with many olive trees damaged.

title: Midnight rescue: Mumbai Police saves newborn abandoned in Goregaon
content: Mumbai Police officers from Bangur Nagar Police Station rescued a newborn baby abandoned between two parked vans in Goregaon. Beat Marshals discovered the infant around midnight and immediately alerted the Nirbhaya Squad. The baby was rushed to Shatabdi Hospital, declared stable, and subsequently handed over to St. Catherine’s Home for care.

title: US 'technical rule' angers China, escalates trade tensions
content: The US expanded its export blacklist to include subsidiaries of listed companies, a move China views as a targeted escalation. This action, effective late September, has intensified the US-China trade war and influenced foreign governments, such as the Netherlands' seizure of chip firm Nexperia due to national security concerns.

title: Women's World Cup: How can India qualify for semis? Scenarios explained
content: Australia, England, and South Africa have secured semi-final berths in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. India, New Zealand, and Sri Lanka are vying for the final spot, with an India-New Zealand clash proving pivotal. A look at the scenarios for the remaining place in the Women's world Cup semi-final.

title: This is how FMCG firms will pass GST 2.0 benefits—It's not cutting prices!
content: Get ready for bigger biscuits and bottles! FMCG companies are bringing back popular price points like Rs 5 and Rs 20 by mid-November. Following GST rate cuts, companies will now offer increased product quantities instead of lower prices, ensuring a win-win for consumers and retailers. This move aims to simplify transactions and restore consumer satisfaction.

title: MP horror: Refused to drive vehicle, Dalit man ‘forced to drink urine’ in Bhind
content: In a disturbing incident in Bhind district, authorities have detained three suspects accused of kidnapping and violently attacking a Dalit driver hailing from Gwalior. The individual revealed harrowing details of physical abuse, being coerced to consume alcohol, and even being forced to ingest urine before being left deserted.

title: Delhi horror: Boy, 5, kidnapped, bludgeoned and stabbed by father’s driver
content: A five-year-old boy was allegedly kidnapped, brutally murdered with bricks and a knife in Narela. Police suspect the boy's father's driver, Neetu, committed the crime to exact revenge after being reprimanded for an altercation. Neetu is currently absconding, and police are actively searching for him.

title: Patient at de-addiction centre ‘tortured to death’ in Meerut
content: A shocking incident unfolded at a Meerut rehabilitation center where a 45-year-old patient, admitted for substance abuse, was allegedly tortured and choked to death by staff. CCTV footage appears to show the man being restrained and gagged. Two workers have been arrested, and an FIR for murder has been filed. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Electric shock car handles, wheels with pepper spray: Mexico gears up for World Cup
content: Mexican security firms are bolstering services for wealthy tourists during the 2026 FIFA World Cup, offering armoured vehicles and armed escorts amid concerns over cartel violence.  Companies are expanding fleets and protective gear, with daily rentals costing up to $1,100.  Despite cartel threats, some experts believe they may not disrupt the tournament.

title: 2 days after Diwali, Delhi choked by thick smog; air quality remains 'very poor'
content: Delhi choked on thick smog two days after Diwali, with air pollution levels soaring to 'very poor'.  AQI reached 345, with some areas hitting 380.  Transport and industrial emissions are major contributors. Residents are reporting breathing issues and eye irritation, highlighting a persistent problem exacerbated by choices like firecrackers.

title: Midnight blaze in Navi Mumbai high-rise: How 10 residents survived
content: A devastating fire ripped through a Vashi high-rise, claiming four lives, including an elderly woman and a young family. The blaze, originating on the 10th floor of Raheja Residency, left ten others hospitalized for smoke inhalation. Authorities are investigating the cause, with Diwali lamps or a short circuit being potential factors. Firefighters battled the flames, while lower-floor residents evacuated safely.

title: US citizenship test: Trump is making it tougher than ever for immigrants to enter American soil
content: America's path to citizenship is becoming more demanding with a new civics exam focusing on deeper historical and governmental understanding. Critics fear this could disadvantage certain groups, while officials argue it ensures better assimilation and contribution. The test's evolution reflects a century-long effort to standardize citizenship requirements.

title: 'Political Islam' inflicted greatest blow on Sanatan Dharma': Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath asserted that "political Islam" significantly impacted Sanatan Dharma, citing historical struggles by figures like Shivaji Maharaj and Maharana Pratap. He lauded the RSS's role in the Ram Temple's construction and announced a ban on Halal-certified products, alleging their profits funded conversions and terrorism. Adityanath outlined five RSS centenary initiatives for a developed India.

title: Chandigarh horror: Man stabs mother 16 times on Diwali, slits throat
content: A 40-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 60-year-old mother 16 times at her Chandigarh residence on Diwali morning. The accused, reportedly mentally disturbed, fled the scene but was apprehended in Sonipat with the murder weapon. Police are investigating the incident further.

title: Nikhil Chaudhary: From Punjab's jr grade to Australia's 1st-class with odd jobs in between
content: From chopping vegetables in a Brisbane restaurant to smashing Haris Rauf for six in the BBL and bagging a fifer on his first-class debut, Nikhil Chaudhary’s journey is one of pure spirit. The former Punjab all-rounder, once juggling odd jobs to survive, now dreams of donning Australia’s yellow — one tick box at a time.

title: Man crashes car into White House gate; Trump inside during incident; arrested immediately
content: A man was arrested late Tuesday after crashing his car into a security gate at the White House. Secret Service officers quickly apprehended the driver, and the vehicle was later confirmed to be safe. President Trump was inside the building at the time, but no lockdown was initiated.

title: Study reveals phone ban in schools boosts test sores, attendance and focus
content: A new Florida study shows that banning mobile phones in schools leads to higher test scores, fewer absences, and initial disciplinary challenges. Supporting research from England, Pakistan, and other US states confirms improved academic performance and reduced distractions. Tools like Yondr pouches have helped schools enforce bans effectively. With more US states adopting phone restrictions, evidence grows that limiting phone use during school hours benefits student focus and achievement.

title: Luigi Mangione was assaulted in Thailand before Manhattan killing — what report says
content: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, reportedly boasted about a violent encounter with "ladyboys" in Bangkok during his backpacking trip. Texts revealed his astonishment at Thailand's healthcare costs and his growing obsession with perceived insurance injustices, leading to his alleged retaliatory shooting upon returning to the US.

title: Confirmed! Footage proves Pak's role in killing three Afghan cricketers - watch
content: Afghanistan Cricket Board claims to have video evidence of Pakistan's involvement in an attack that killed three local cricketers. Consequently, Afghanistan has withdrawn from the upcoming Tri-Nation T20I Series in Pakistan. The ICC and BCCI have expressed support for Afghanistan following the incident.

title: ‘Festival of lights’: PM Modi thanks Trump for Diwali greetings
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi  on Wednesday thanked US President Donald Trump for his Diwali greetings and phone call, highlighting India and the US as "great democracies" united against terrorism. Trump also extended Diwali wishes, mentioning discussions on trade and the situation with Pakistan, despite recent US tariffs on Indian oil imports.

title: Stock market holiday on Bali Pratipada: Will NSE, BSE remain closed for trading today?
content: Stock markets, including NSE and BSE, remained closed on October 22 for Balipratipada. This follows a positive Muhurat trading session yesterday, which marked the start of Samvat Year 2082. Regular trading operations are scheduled to resume on October 23.

title: Rock and rule: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi still drums heavy metal and loves Metallica
content: Japan's new Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, is a devoted heavy metal fan who plays drums to de-stress.  Despite her passion for music and promises of more women in cabinet, she appointed only two female ministers. Takaichi, a conservative politician, has held multiple cabinet roles and admires Margaret Thatcher.

title: Not in your brain, top neurosurgeon explains how dementia can start ‘in your legs’
content: Early signs of dementia may not always manifest as memory loss but can appear as subtle changes in leg health and walking. Weak leg muscles, reduced walking speed, and altered gait can signal declining brain-body communication and circulation, potentially preceding cognitive issues. Monitoring these physical red flags offers an opportunity for early intervention and improved quality of life.

title: Chennai rain: Holiday declared for schools; IMD issues warning
content: Chengalpet, Tiruvallur, Cuddalore, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur and Mayiladuthurai district collectors declared a holiday for schools and colleges on Wednesday.

title: Virat Kohli on notice! Mitchell Starc to repeat Perth tactics in Adelaide
content: Australian batter Matthew Short anticipates pacers will continue targeting Virat Kohli outside off stump after his duck in the first ODI. Kohli, returning to action after a break, faces a must-win scenario in Adelaide, his most successful overseas venue. Short also discussed his own role and preparation for the 2027 World Cup.

title: 'Blacklisted': UK-based researcher deported from IGI; officials cite visa norms violation
content: London-based academic Francesca Orsini was denied entry into India and deported after being blacklisted for violating her tourist visa conditions by conducting research. Officials stated that undertaking research requires a specific 'R' visa, and violating visa terms can lead to blacklisting, a sovereign right of any nation.

title: NASA quasi moon begins 50 year journey around Earth until 2038
content: Earth has a new cosmic companion, a 19-meter asteroid named 2025 PN7, discovered in August 2025. This 'quasi-moon' will orbit near Earth for about 50 years, until 2083. Scientists are excited as it offers a unique opportunity to study solar system dynamics and potentially ancient materials, posing no threat to our planet.

title: American Airlines flight makes emergency landing after pilots mistake crew for hijackers
content: An American Airlines flight bound for Los Angeles made an emergency return to Omaha after pilots mistook cabin crew knocking on the cockpit door for a hijacking attempt. A glitch in the intercom system caused the miscommunication, leading to the safe landing and subsequent apology from the captain. The airport confirmed no security threat.

title: 'Virat, Rohit got found out': Australia's McGrath reacts to cricketers' ODI return
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's return to international cricket after an eight-month break saw them struggle on Perth's bouncy pitch, failing to make a significant impact against Australia. Both veterans were dismissed cheaply, raising questions about their form and future in the squad, especially with the 2027 World Cup on the horizon.

title: Conor McGregor & Dee Devlin Net Worth 2025: Inside their Irish empire of love & business
content: Conor McGregor, a renowned UFC fighter, has built a significant financial empire beyond his fighting career. His success is amplified by his partner, Dee Devlin, who manages his business operations. Together, this Irish power couple has transformed fame into a lasting business legacy, demonstrating the strength of teamwork and shared ambition.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB misses practice
content: Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury continues to sideline the Baltimore Ravens quarterback, raising doubts about his availability for Sunday's crucial game against the Chicago Bears. Missing the past two games and Monday's practice, Jackson's return is vital for the 1-5 Ravens to salvage their disappointing 2025 season and playoff hopes.

title: Mitch Marner sparks Vegas shakeup: Confident comment after first goals
content: Mitch Marner's two-goal outburst against the Calgary Flames has revitalized the Vegas Golden Knights, propelling them to the top of the Pacific Division.  His return to form, coupled with a perfect power play performance, signals a strong start to his debut season in Vegas, promising exciting times ahead for the team and its fans.

title: 'He’s destroying your house': Hillary slams Trump over White House demolition for new ballroom
content: President Trump's plan for a $250 million private White House ballroom has drawn sharp criticism from Hillary Clinton, who decried the project as a misuse of public property. Demolition has begun on the East Wing, with the massive ballroom slated to accommodate nearly 1,000 guests, dwarfing the current East Room. Despite ongoing construction, formal approval from planning commissions is pending.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How did Brendan Allen upsetting Reinier de Ridder shake things up?
content: reinier de Ridder is now ahead of the top-ranked middleweight . he's the only other weight class with changes in these rankings is heavyweight, because Francis Ngannou has not fought in just over a year and was removed as ineligible .
